cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 165 mi (265 km) SE of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across Cuba, then north-northwest over the eastern Gulf, curving northeast along the U.S. Southeast coast and offshore of the Mid-Atlantic/New England coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west coast of Florida (near the Big Bend region)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Englewood FL northward to the Aucilla River, upper Florida Keys, parts of Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Florida Keys (Craig Key to Dry Tortugas) and west coast of Florida from Flamingo to Englewood; Hurricane Warning for Cienfuegos to Matanzas Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida west coast, Georgia and Carolina coasts, extending northward toward the Mid-Atlantic and southern New England coasts
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤3%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions with gusts possible late Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (generally <3 ft) possible in the New York Harbor if the center passes close to the coast and coincides with high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Friday into early Saturday, locally higher in bands
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado or waterspout risk south of the port (primarily NJ coastline) as Elsa accelerates northeastward
